author: Jay
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
content: I've mostly used HP laser printers over the years. The last one I bought was a Brother. Worked great for a year or so then started smudging quite badly, even after changing everything, toner and drum. I also paid the expensive price for an OEM toner cartridge for this HP. I'm tired of the knockoffs that are not consistent and don't last as long as they say. Highly recommended printer for home or small office.Update:Just after the return window closed, it began doing daily paper jams. I am very disappointed but am stuck with it. Also, the OEM toner cartridge I bought makes a knocking noise for the first 10 or so prints. Like most everything, HP isn't what it used to be.Update 2It got to where it jammed constantly so is now unusable, two months after purchase. I bought another one with a warranty this time. Hope I don't have to use it.

content: I was not expecting much from this Amazon Warehouse 2nd. The discription said it had blemishes, but the price was too good to pass up. Blemishes? I  had to look really hard to find them. author: Sagewood
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
content: I ordered this HP LaserJet printer to use in my business office, and the instructions are well lay-out with easy to follow step by step set-up process. I have used it only for a few days and found it to be really easy to operate. It is really great for our little business office as everyone is located in a close space in the same building; as we were able to connect our desktops and laptops to it without any hassles. I found the printer to be really compact and it was easy to find a convenient place to locate it in the office. I like this printer a lot as it comes with a 2- line LCD display which I found to easy and convenient to manage my printing, and also have the eco-friendly black toner, large output bin for it's size, and the Auto On/Off feature which I found really helpful.This printer has two downsides though: the price is relatively on the high side, and the fact that it uses only wired network connection to print.

author: Riktar
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
content: This laser jet pro is a serious performer given the proper configuration. If you want something to run wirelessly for a small office that doesn’t have Ethernet/ LAN configuration, this isn’t for you. With that said, if you have the proper ecosystem established, this printer is a vertical or tour de force. I have mine configured in my home office running directly to the router hub via Ethernet cable. This would mean that as long as you access the LAN you can send print jobs to the printer.Being a laser printer, it’s blazing fast! The print is crisp and lines are sharp. I use this to print a lot of legal documents and declarations and it’s been holding up incredibly well. It is also very good on toner ( ink) conservation. If you want something suited for small to medium office use or even personal (given the connectivity limitation) I have no problems recommending this. Overall a stout performer at a reasonable price point.

author: Raf
date: Reviewed in Italy on November 9, 2022
content: La mia prima laser.Stanco di cartucce delle inkjet che finiscono subito e ugelli che si intasano, ho preso questa: volevo una stampante che facesse bene il suo lavoro senza fronzoli.Questa lo è...forse anche troppo. Col senno di poi forse avrei preso quella con lo scanner, sebbene ormai con gli smartphone...L'unico neo, forse un po' rumorosa in fase di stampa, ma è molto veloce, per cui si sopporta.Aggiornamento: il toner originale è durato un anno per circa 1500 stampe "da ufficio"; ha avvisato a segnalare "toner in esaurimento" circa un mese prima che finisse effettivamente

author: Christina Jones- ThinkPINK IT
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2022
content: I love this printer for a lot of reasons, and the top would be the setup. It was flawless and fast. This is key when I am setting user PC's up. I was able to add it to the network and all the users were able to discover it quickly. The print quality is pretty good for this printer and I would definitely recommend this for someone who is doing a lot of standard printing. This particular one was setup in a medical environment to print receipts and other paperwork.HP really has great support on the printer side and I am able to reach out with issues and get them resolved fast for clients. I have rarely had to use the support- if that is to say much.Want something that prints good and easy to set-up? Then you can rely on this model to do the trick for you and be a good printer.

author: Crazy Hick in NH
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2021
content: I bought this printer last year, end of April 2020. Great printer in a small footprint/package. Recently, we decided to get another for an employee to do "check runs" -- not tie up a community printer (nothing worse than someone printing an email on check paper). Imagine my surprise -- I paid $170 on 30-Apr-20 (sold and shipped by the all-mighty AMZ) and now, a little over a year later, holy crap, the same exact printer (sold and shipped by AMZ) costs $300. Wait, WHAT!?!?!? I guess this proves space flight isn't cheap. Anyway, pandemic, supply chain, inflation and tax manipulation aside, it's a KICKAZZ little printer (would expect nothing less from HP). That said, it's not worth $300. Maybe in 10-15 years.

author: Rach
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
content: I don’t understand the negative reviews for this. I literally took it out of the box, plugged it in, added it as a printer on my computer and printed. Worked like a charm. If you have bought a printer before you know NO printer comes with a cable (only the power cord), so make sure you add one to your cart. And any product that comes with an ink cartridge is ALWAYS a sample and won’t last very longer. So get a extra cartridge. All of this is written in the description. Even if you bought this in a store it would be the same thing. I would definitely recommend this printer.

author: Earth Spirits
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
content: I really like this little M404n from HP. It changes the narrative on what a laser printer usually means as far as size and weight. Yes it still weighs in at about 18 lbs but that is less than most lasers. And the compact 15" x 14" x 8" size and almost square shape makes for an easy to place printer. I like how all the components and controls are also kept minimal and within the footprint of the printer. I looks nice enough to leave out in plain sight for those with a home office. It is very unobtrusive to have in a public office area as well.I think it is quiet and speedy. It can print out a page in about 2 seconds depending on the graphics and text ratios. It is also relatively quiet compared to most lasers.It has a built-in ethernet jack so you can print from network connected computers and devices. Wireless is not available on this model. You have to get the M404dw if you need wireless capabilities which for the currently $90 price difference is probably worth it to get.The printer is recognized on a Mac OS within the print utility. Great compact form and excellent functioning capabilities. 5 stars.

author: Sarah
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
content: I was able to unbox and set this up in just under a half hour.  It is very simply packaged and does not require a lot of instruction for setup.  You’re instructed to download the hp smart app and follow the onscreen instructions.This does not come with an Ethernet cable for a wired connection, I’m really not sure why his wasn’t included.The printer itself is compact and well built.  I was afraid I was going to end up with this massive monster printer sitting next to my small desk, but it really is the perfect size for a home office.This printer has the capability to print double sided, not really a feature I use often but nice to know it’s there.  The printing is clear and high quality.  It also is surprisingly fast and much more quiet than what I’m used to.  The paper tray is easy to load.This is very important, this is a black and white printer ONLY!! I actually wanted only black and white since I will be printing business documents, contracts and things of that nature.  There is a color model available but it costs more.The downside to this printer is the cartridges are super pricey.  I hope the one that came with this printer lasts a really long time !

author: MadROMAD
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
content: This thing can print much faster than what I had hooked up before.  This requires a wired connection, and does not print in color.  Those are the only 2 drawbacks imo, but I can look past that.  Well, if you count the super expensive toner replacement, that would be a 3rd drawback.With that out of the way, the rest of this is really easy and intuitive to use.  The instructions are easy enough to follow, and setup was a breeze.Prints much faster than what I'm used too, and that is pleasing.  The quality of the print is nice too.  Clean lines, with no smudging.It's a little bit louder than what I'm used too, but still quieter than the larger ones.  Paper moves through smoothly, and I've only had a couple of jams.  Personally, I think the jams were due to some bent corners on the pages.  My kids were in it the other day, stealing some paper from it.Don't buy this for home use.  You can find better options, if that's what you need.  This is perfect for my small business though!

author: Kay
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
content: I usually don't get excited about printers but this is the exception. I really wanted this to use for my art. I print out black and white photos of family (started with my grandson) and use colored pencils to bring those prints to life. I use a 45# or 60# stock paper, depending which brand pencils I plan to use. I absolutely love my HP LaserJet Pro! I can do so many different things with it. Not just my art (admittedly my primary use) but for any of my printing needs. No need to run to the local library or printshop any more. The initial ink cartridge came with it. The user's manual states I can get approximately 2,000 prints from each cartridge, give or take depending on light/darkness setting. This printer is made to last, it's space friendly and doesn't take up a lot of space, it's quiet and so many more positive things I could say about it. I've always liked HP products and that continues. I trust Hewitt Packard and I'm so thankful for this printer and how it opened an entirely new dimension to my art.

author: Michael
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2019
content: It's a nice little network printer. I like how there's a large XL cartridge for it. It has a 250 sheet input tray and you can get a 550 sheet input tray as an add-on. Most important, it's worked without issue.I plugged it into my network, downloaded the full driver, and ran the driver to install it. It took 15 minutes to install and I was off and running. I did have to supply my own network cable, but printers don't really come with cables so I expected that.There are more expensive printers with more features. The base model I got does not do double-sided. But it is printing great and we've had zero issues with it. I like it.

author: mudpie
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019
content: This M404n replaced my old M402n at my office.  It operates and looks the same as my previous printer, but even if it didn't, there wouldn't have been much of a learning curve.  It's simple and straightforward. It has a relatively small footprint. Installation was a breeze. The prints are crisp and clear and it handles mailing (labels and envelopes) quite nicely. I print a couple of hundred pages and about 50 envelopes a day and it powers through it all. It makes some noise, but not so much that it bothers me.  I don't expect a silent printer. The tray is easy to load.  The occasional jams on my previous HP were easy to clear and since this printer is nearly identical I expect they will be too.  But I haven't had any jams for the few weeks I've been using it. And you can't beat getting a great printer at a price like this. I highly recommend this one!

content: It prints in black and white, no color.  Very basic.  It prints copies fast. The print quality is good.  Wasn't hard to install. author: Herb Runbridge
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
content: Bought it two weeks ago to replace a 23 year old Laserjet 6P that still worked, but slow. My new Laserjet M404n is a dream. Driver installed in 10 minutes on my Windows 10 computer, ethernet cable to my modem, now I can print from my laptop as well as my desktop. It’s fast, quiet, reliable, a very good value for around $150. Best purchase I’ve made all year.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

name: HP LaserJet Pro M404n Monochrome Printer with built-in Ethernet (W1A52A)
description:
BUILT TO KEEP YOUR BUSINESS MOVING FORWARD – Print consistently high-quality documents with the HP LaserJet Pro M404n, a monochrome laser printer designed to let you focus on growing your business
HP WOLF PRO SECURITY – Protect company data and safeguard against cyberattacks with protection built into the printer hardware, firmware and OS
SPEED THROUGH TASKS – Stay productive with a 250-sheet input tray, fast first page out time, and print speeds of up to 40 pages per minute from this black and white laser printer
SHARE RESOURCES ON YOUR NETWORK – Easily access, print, and share resources with built-in Ethernet capabilities
ENHANCED ENERGY EFFICIENCY – Designed with the environment in mind, the HP LaserJet Pro M404n saves up to 18% energy over prior products, with technologies that help reduce paper waste
COMPACT SIZE - Make the most of your office space with a compact printer that conveniently fits into your shared work area
TONER CARTRIDGES YOU CAN TRUST – Avoid reprints, wasted supplies, and service calls by using Original HP 58A/58X toner cartridges designed for your monochrome laser printer
sustainability_features:
Manufacturing practices
Manufactured using processes that reduce the risk of negative environmental impact.
As certified by
author: Angela
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
content: As a work from home, and small business owner, this printer is AWESOME!  It has a smaller footprint than most MF ink-jet printers, a faster warm up than other laser jets!  Having a laser printer for forms, applications, emails etc is awesome, not having to worry about the hassles of ordering ink constantly, or finding it out of stock!  Knowing I can just add the dash button and order and have it here in 2 days is even more awesome!

author: Gustaf T
date: Reviewed in Sweden on January 24, 2024
content: For me, these are totally unusable.The colors are excellent, and many people seem to like them1. They bleed through normal thickness book paper even when used at good speed2. They leave an ink blot at the end of each line.3. The tips are too wide for most printed text4. They are difficult to use because of the hard tips - you must hold the pen at exactly the correct angle to cover the full width of the text

author: SteGrue
date: Reviewed in Germany on January 14, 2021
content: Das Produkt kam m.E. ziemlich zerschlissen bei mir an s. Bilder. Die Verpackung ist auf der einen Seite komplett aufgerissen, auf der anderen teilweise eingerissen. Hilfsmäßig ist der Verschluß mit Tesa zugeklebt. Ob die Stifte bereits in Gebrauch waren, kann ich nicht sagen; augenscheinlich nicht. Ich habe den Eindruck, dass mir hier B-Ware - angedreht wäre wohl zu negativ formuliert - verkauft wurde.

author: Eda Senyuva
date: Reviewed in Germany on September 12, 2024
content: Ich hätte nicht gedacht, dass es möglich ist, "schlechte" Marker zu kaufen. Die Deckel lassen sich nur mit erheblichem Kraftaufwand abnehmen und man muss die Marker stets ganz aufrecht halten, damit sie einen dicken Markerstrich zu Papier bringen. Hält man ihn auch nur leicht verwinkelt, stößt nur die Kante des Stiftes auf das Papier... Das ist super unpraktisch, insbesondere wenn man viel markieren und lesen muss.

content: Ho provato quelli  di una ditta concorrente (sempre acquistati su Amazon) e non c'è confronto. A me servono per evidenziare dei libri, ma questi non si riesce a fare una riga giusta. Scorrono con difficoltà e se si usano dalla parte più grossa spesso fanno due righe, se si mettono in obliquo il segno non viene bene.Ovviamente può essere che mi sia arrivata una partita difettosa ma li ho provati tutti su un foglio di carta e non ce n'è uno che si salva. author: Karen
date: Reviewed in Italy on March 27, 2021
content: Ho acquistato questi evidenziatori per il loro costo decisamente competitivo, purtroppo il rapporto qualità/prezzo è un po' carente, quando gli ho provati per la prima volta sono rimasta piacevolmente compita, dei bellissimi colori, solo il lilla sembra più un viola. Peccato che dopo nemmeno una settimana di utilizzo le punte hanno iniziato a rovinarsi (vedi foto) e soprattutto il giallo si è già scaricato, cosa che non mi era mai successa dopo così poco tempo con altre marche.Do' 3 stelle perché comunque sono validi ma durano poco.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: Cliente Amazon
date: Reviewed in Italy on February 8, 2021
content: Ordine consegnato con estrema puntualità. Pacchetto integro.Purtroppo gli evidenziatori non sono molto "pastello", ma risultano molto intensi (in particolare il verde). Sono anche troppo spessi per come li utilizzo io e, avendo una punta molto rigida, è difficile usarli "in orizzontale" invece che in verticale (esce una linea molto molto sottile e non si ha un buon controllo del tratto).Li ho acquistati perché più economici degli analoghi Stabilo, ma per quanto mi riguarda non c'è confronto né per l'intensità né per la morbidezza del tratto.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: LucaRoss
date: Reviewed in Italy on March 2, 2021
content: Li ho acquistati attratta dal basso costo e dai colori che, dalle foto, sembravano carini. Mi sono appena arrivati ed ho voluto subito provarli. Diciamo che sono un po' delusa: come potete ben vedere, il tratto (soprattutto del violetto) non è continuo ed inoltre tutti i colori lasciano alla fine del tratto una macchia. Diciamo che non li riacquisterei, ma non li rendo perché tutto sommato i colori mi soddisfano.  Sono molto ergonomici

author: Cino Wang Platania
date: Reviewed in Italy on March 22, 2023
content: Purtroppo, la durezza della punta e la durata limitata dell'inchiostro sono fattori molto importanti per un evidenziatore. Se la punta è troppo dura, può causare problemi di precisione e di copertura. Se l'inchiostro dura poco, l'evidenziatore diventa inutilizzabile in poco tempo, il che lo rende poco conveniente e poco economico.Detto ciò, la descrizione dei produttori sembrava promettente, con una punta a scalpello per due spessori di tratto e un'inchiostro universale in colori pastello alla moda. Inoltre, la forma piatta con angoli arrotondati e il cappuccio con clip sembravano convenienti per l'uso quotidiano.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: design monkey
date: Reviewed in Germany on August 5, 2024
content: Nachdem ich jetzt mal alle Farben getestet habe, muss ich leider sagen, dass mir die Farben einfach zu kräftig sind. Hätte die Farben heller erwartet und sind auch etwas dunkler als die Kappen erwarten lassen.Wenn einem die Farben nicht ganz so wichtig sind, dann sind diese Textmarker schon ganz gut – würden aber trotzdem nur 4 Sterne erhalten. Grund dafür sind die Kappen, die einfach viel zu schwer abzuziehen sind. Wieso muss ich erst einen Schutzkreis um mich herum klarmachen, damit ich nichts vom Tisch haue oder jemanden treffe, wenn ich eine Kappe vom Textmarker abziehen muss? Ist nicht bei jedem der Textmarker so schlimm, aber bei keinem gut.Deshalb: auch wenn die Textmarker sehr günstig sind und ihre Aufgabe erfüllen, ist das Produkt eben doch nur Durchschnitt. Da werde ich in Zukunft wieder zu Muji zurückkehren.

author: Sneha Nirhali
date: Reviewed in India on November 30, 2022
content:
The media could not be loaded.
                



The neon ones that you get in the market are so much cheaper and smoother. These Schneider ones might work well if you are just planning to highlight some notes. But with that being said, the highlighters feel very blotchy and dry at the same time. Some are too pigmented, so you have to glide them on carefully. Personally, I can't hold them with ease, they feel bulky in my hands and I can't control the stroke well. Hoping that this gets better with time. I can't throw them away since they are so expensive, so I'll try to use them carefully. Maybe I'm just bad at art and should stick to plain old highlighting instead. But either way I don't think I will buy these again.

content: First of all highlighter packet seemed to have been repacked after opening. Still I kept them as I was not sure of it. Especially if you want to avoid blotting issue in cheap highlighters.

author: Giulia D.
date: Reviewed in Italy on June 3, 2021
content: Li uso da Gennaio sull'agenda (quindi non è che stia a sottolineare interi brani come uno studente) e devo dire che la qualità all'inizio mi sembrava migliore, quasi tutti non si aprono più bene (la punta si incastra nel tappo) ed è quasi impossibile usarli. Le tinte sono anche carine, ma non le definirei proprio "pastello", fatta eccezione per il lilla, che è veramente bello, e il giallo, che ha quella sfumatura aranciata tipica anche di altre marche. Gli altri sono appena più tenui del loro corrispettivo più carico, specie il rosa, che sulla pagina è scurissimo.Mi spiace ma la prossima volta mi orienterò sui ben noti pastello della famosa casa di produzione, nonostante il prezzo alto.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: InsiemeVuoto
date: Reviewed in Italy on July 11, 2023
content: Gli evidenziatori Schneider Job 150 hanno una serie di punti di forza che li distinguono dagli altri sul mercato. Ogni evidenziatore emana una lucentezza delicata ma vibrante, che dona alle pagine un aspetto accattivante e piacevole. Mi sono trovato ad ammirare la bellezza di queste sfumature pastello, che hanno dato un tocco di eleganza e raffinatezza ai miei appunti.Un altro punto di forza è la versatilità dei tratti offerti dagli evidenziatori. La punta a scalpello permette di scegliere tra due spessori di tratto: uno fine da 1 mm e uno largo da 5 mm. Questa opzione consente una maggiore flessibilità nell'evidenziare testo di diverse dimensioni o nel creare sfumature e disegni più dettagliati. Ho apprezzato particolarmente la punta fine quando dovevo evidenziare parti più piccole del testo o sottolineare dettagli importanti, mentre la punta larga era ideale per evidenziare testo generale o creare effetti artistici.Un aspetto che non posso trascurare è la resistenza alla luce degli evidenziatori. L'inchiostro universale utilizzato è di alta qualità, il che significa che le mie annotazioni rimarranno nitide e leggibili nel tempo. Ho notato che, anche dopo settimane, gli evidenziatori non svaniscono o sbiadiscono come altri che ho provato in passato. Questa caratteristica mi ha dato la sicurezza che i miei appunti sarebbero rimasti nitidi e professionali, senza compromettere la leggibilità nel corso del tempo.Nonostante i punti di forza sopra elencati, gli evidenziatori Schneider Job 150 presentano anche alcuni punti di debolezza che vale la pena menzionare. Il principale aspetto negativo che ho riscontrato è la durata dell'inchiostro. Sebbene gli evidenziatori siano di alta qualità e vibranti, ho notato che si scaricano piuttosto velocemente. Questo è stato un po' deludente, poiché mi aspettavo una maggiore durata dell'inchiostro considerando il prezzo del prodotto.Un altro punto di debolezza è il corpo degli evidenziatori. Sebbene il corpo in polipropilene resistente all'evaporazione sia comodo da impugnare e abbia una forma sottile che facilita il trasporto, ho notato che il meccanismo di chiusura del cappuccio non è molto affidabile. A volte, il cappuccio si sfila facilmente, rischiando di rovinare l'inchiostro o macchiare altre superfici. Avrei preferito un sistema di chiusura più sicuro per evitare questi inconvenienti.In conclusione, gli evidenziatori Schneider Job 150 sono un'aggiunta colorata e versatile alla mia esperienza di scrittura ed evidenziazione. La gamma di colori pastello è semplicemente mozzafiato e offre un tocco di eleganza ai miei appunti.Tuttavia, è importante tenere presente che gli evidenziatori tendono a scaricarsi abbastanza velocemente.Nel complesso, nonostante i punti di debolezza, gli evidenziatori Schneider Job 150 rimangono una scelta eccellente per chi cerca una tavolozza di colori pastello di alta qualità.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: L.B test and Management
date: Reviewed in France on March 23, 2023
content: Les surligneurs avec leurs six couleurs différentes sont un choix fantastique pour tous ceux qui cherchent à organiser leur travail ou leurs études avec une grande variété de couleurs. Ces surligneurs sont également très durables car je les utilise tous les jours depuis un an et ils ont encore une bonne performance. De plus, leur prix abordable les rend accessibles à tous les budgets, ce qui en fait un choix populaire pour les étudiants, les professionnels et les amateurs de papeterie. Les couleurs vives et lumineuses des surligneurs sont parfaites pour mettre en évidence des informations importantes dans tes documents, tes livres et tes notes de cours. Leur design élégant et ergonomique assure une prise en main confortable et facile, ce qui rend leur utilisation agréable et pratique. En somme, si tu cherches des surligneurs abordables, durables et colorés, ces surligneurs sont un choix idéal pour toi.

author: Amazon Customer
date: Reviewed in India on November 29, 2022
content: See this Highlighter has good controlled ink flow but the nib of faber-castell pastel highlighter is much better and ergonomic than this highlighter, though this highlighter ink do not smudge or bleed off in most of the papers. Pro-Tip: Always Place your highlighters (of any company) upside down, it will guarantee you they do not bleed that much through the papers when you use them. Rest depends how the highlighter flows its ink. For this one i would recommend once try Fabercastell Pastel Highlighter they are literally bang for the buck, this highlighter set would be good if it came in under ₹250, this Schneider one costs much higher not because of good build quality only rather of its import duties and various design awards, please dont be fooled by this that only costly highlighters are always best. Try fabercastell you will feel there's nt much difference. except for some thickness of papers. Bleeding occurs but hey, you will pay 5x less.This highlighter has varied pastel colors in wallet but yes they are cute and small and have good build quality but performance and convinience wise, i would rather rate it okay okay types. Rest is good.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

author: Sandy
date: Reviewed in France on July 16, 2023
content: Pour l'instant je les ai utilisé sur un papier tout fin qui boit beaucoup l'ancre donc les couleurs ont l'air plus foncé que sur les photos de l'annonce, mais je suppose que cela dépend du support que l'ont utiliser pour colorier... Je pense que sur un papier plus lisse ou même du papier photo ça donne des couleurs bien pastel, bien clair, et moi c'est ce que je voulais donc ça me vas.

author: Lyne
date: Reviewed in France on April 25, 2023
content: Ils sont vraiment très bien, les couleurs sont agréables et pas fluo comme la plupart des surligneurs. Donc je ne les referme plus tant que je n'ai pas fini ma session de relecture.

author: Nanita
date: Reviewed in France on October 2, 2022
content: Je viens de les utiliser pour la première fois et je suis un peu surprise. Ayant l'habitude d'utiliser des surligneurs basiques comme BIC, ceux-là ont une mine dure et sèche même si l'encre ressort très bien c'est assez particulier. Malheureusement l'encre passe un peu au travers de la feuille mais les couleurs sont jolies, j'aime beaucoup ça change des autres couleurs qu'on a pour habitude d'utiliser.A voir dans le temps ce que ça donne mais pour le prix (3 euros et des poussières au lieu de 11 pendant une promo) ça vaut le coup !

author: Sara
date: Reviewed in Italy on November 8, 2022
content: Buon prodotto di cartoleria e, come da titolo, non ha nulla da invidiare ad altri marchi. L'articolo dura nel tempo e presenta un colore delicato ma allo stesso tempo un tratto deciso. Colori pastello bellissimi e molto comoda la confezione richiudibile. La punta non risulta estremamente morbida, si possono quindi ottenere linee più sottili e decise a seconda dell'inclinazione. Do 4 stelle perché ho riscontrato un problema su carta molto sottile: il colore con questo tipo di carta riesce, purtroppo, ad oltrepassare la pagina e a macchiarla dall'altro lato. Nel complesso comunque promosso.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: Samantha
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2021
content: I utilize highlighters FREQUENTLY, EVERY DAY @ WORK to color code different sections for works taks of the day.  I am known as an "office-supply-snob" because I'd rather buy my own supplies than use the "bulk" items provided by employers.  These suite my needs well. Bright. Not too dark.  I do not like highlighters that you use and can no longer see the printed material. My motto or thought process is, if I have to spend hours writing, I should enjoy it, & have quality items that I enjoy using. I like multicolored, small volume. The pink yellow and orange are ones I use, but I have a colleague that is fond of green. So the green gets gifted to her. Usually there is a blue in multicolored packs, which also is gifted to colleagues.  Not an issue for this pack. Would definitely buy again.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

name: Xerox B310DNI Printer, Laser, B&W, Wireless, Print, Letter, Energy Star Certified, UP to 36PPM
description:
WORK FROM HOME: Perfect for small teams or home offices that need technology that fits in tight spaces and is easy to set up. The Xerox B310 Printer is perfect for anyone looking for a small, heavy-duty, reliable, wireless printer.
OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE: Wireless printer, with print speeds of up to 40 A4-sized pages per minute, automatic two-sided printing, 250-sheet paper capacity and high-resolution image quality.
CONVENIENCE AND CONNECTIVITY: Built-in Wi-Fi and support for Apple AirPrint, Mopria Print Service and Chromebook printing means the B310 is made for users who print from a wide range of mobile devices. Apesar de las malas reseñas que tiene decidí comprarla por la marca Xerox crei que sería buena opción pero no lo fue. La instalé en una Mac pero nunca imprimió, mandaba a impresión pero solo decía ocupada y jamás imprimió,  llamé a Xerox muy amablemente me dieron asesoría vía remota pero ellos tampoco pudieron instalarla correctamente ni hacer que imprimiera, con la aplicación de iPhone jamás pudimos enlazarla, pensado que sería el sistema operativo intentamos con Android y fue lo mismo no pudimos, la instalamos en un equipo Windows y tampoco fue posible. Me contacté directo con el vendedor y solo me dijo que presionara la tecla X y jamás me volvió a responder. La devolví, y Amazon como siempre su servicio al cliente impecable obtuve mi reembolso sin problema. Muy bien Amazon, fatal el vendedor.

author: jack j. messina
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022
content: Nice size. Very easy to install without drivers though adding the specific driver for the machine as opposed to “air print” makes it more accessible to all devices. The tech support is absolutely amazing and rivals Apple. That alone is worth the purchase. The biggest concern is ink refills. They are expensive, but do allow printing of 6000 sheets.

author: C
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024
content: As the title says, it prints well and it scans well… when it’s connected to the computer. The wifi connection is great when it works, that is maybe 25% of the time. You cannot have the printer off when you start your computer or it will refuse to connect to your computer despite HP Smart saying that it is connected to your computer. If you don’t have it connected when you start, you might as well forget about printing. There is NO OPTION FOR USB, you have no choice but to use the wireless connection and thus when it doesn’t connect the 75% of the time it doesn’t wanna work, you’re SOL. It is not worth the hassle nor is it worth the ink subscription that you’re basically forced into getting. I would not recommend this printer at all, buy from another company or just go back to inkjet.

author: Christopher Raven
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
content: I purchased this printer on June 14th 2024 and ALWAYS had connectivity problems from the start (even when my computer wi-fi was up and running great) Not sure why I constantly had problems. I would say this printer worked less than 50% of the time.  Not sure what happened, I always tried to trouble shoot it on my computer but nothing ever worked! extremely disappointed with this and I'm 100% going to now buy a computer that connects to the computer via USB cord.  This taught me a lesson that I learned and that Is to not have a Wi-Fi printer...It sounds good at 1st but the connectivity issues and never being able to print anything is why the printer ended up how it did.  (I smashed my hand on top of the printer causing the glass to break and then went out in the alley to smash it on the ground 5 or 6 times)

author: Cimmerian
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
content: I've been installing printers for 30 years.... this was the most frustrating install ever.1.  They REALLY want you to get the  smart app from MS store.  You can find an allinone driver online if you look, this is what I did.2. The printer could not be found in wifi discovery mode using a win10 virtual machine.  I tried running the install/discovery over usb  with my virtual machine only to end with an "unknown error' in HPs software.3. I had to dig out a full win 10 laptop for this to find the printer at all....  It did find a printer on the network (i guess step 2 kind of worked when it prompted for wifi / pw).  I had to again go through half a dozen questions about sharing info, create accounts etc...4.  With the software finally complete (1hour in)  I launch the HP smart app in win10 because I want to scan a document.  I am prompted with a "In order to scan, please sign in with your HP account"  ....  WTF???  No, just no.  I am in no way signin into HP services to use my own scanner.That's the last straw.So, I can't scan unless my internet is up and running since scanning is now an HP cloud service????Every time I launch the HP smart app, Ihave to again answer the same " please share your diagnostic data with HP"  over and over and over.I had a Brother all in one.... that is what I should have bought again.... serves me right for going cheap.A printer should plug right in or be wifi configurable from an LCD panel.  It should scan to a network location/nas/connected storage without the need of an online cloud service.  It should work with a a linux 'generic laser' printer device.  This P.O.S. does none of that.Do not buy this.  I promise you it is frustration in a box.

author: Amazon Customer
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
content: Update: Stay away! Printer has been nerfed and is now a paperweight due to a reported issue with my HP Account. HP will try to push their toner subscription on you, Instant Ink. I declined and have been using HP toner purchased directly. This has not stopped what is likely a software error on their end from turning off my ability to use the device. The printer throws an account error. Getting help from HP is an exercise in frustration. I likely only managed 200 pages out of this printer since I've owned it. Permanently done with HP.My main requirement for a printer is that it is reliably available. I ditched a Brother printer that presented chronic connection issues via direct USB cable for this HP laser multi-function unit. It isn't any better!I have a powerful router, and everything else in my house, electronics of various kinds, have no issues staying connected, but this HP printer can be relied on to drop the WIFI signal from just across the room. It annoys me that nearly every time I need to print, I have to waste 15-20 minutes cycling the power and the wifi, and that's if it decides to connect at all.

content: First try to figure out how to set this thing up without creating an account, handing over all your personal info and wasting hours retrying.  Good luck fella, it's not going to happen. It will be much less painful.

content: After two weeks, HP Smart Software stopped detecting my printer for no apparent reason.  Can't scan from HP software but am forced to use default Windows to do scanning. As certified by
author: Diane Adams
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
content: I'm using this with an iPad. Wireless set up took 1 minute using WPS. You do not have to use the HP Smart app to set-up, print or make copies. You do have to use it to scan. And you do have to give it access to your wireless network to scan. However you do not need it for anything but scanning and you can turn off its' permission to the network under settings, Privacy, on the iPad. You can tell HP not to annoy you with anything when you set up the account. It cost $99.99 when I bought it in August, so a pretty good deal as my Canon copier (I bought the HP primarily to make copies) has an issue with the laser unit right now. From my quick look at the HP Smart app I judge it, the app, to be somewhat difficult to use but very full featured if that is what you are looking for. This printer/copier/scanner is small, lightweight and fast and very easy to use. For those who say that the app doesn't work on a desktop, there is a separate piece of software for the desktop machines. And for those who found no directions, you must download the user manual from HP. Just Google "HP LaserJet MFP M140w Wireless Printer user manual" and get it. The quick start guide is in the box as is the power cord. You can attach this printer to a desktop/laptop via USB with the proper cord which is not included.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

author: OldMan
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
content: I came out of retirement about 24 months ago to assist a former client with a project.  My Brother multifunction machine, purchased back in 2017, quit working after updating my notebook’s operating system and I decided it was time to replace to the Brother.  I didn’t want to spend more than $200 as the assignment is nearing completion and decided on the HP M140W with wireless printing and scanning abilities.  I’ve now been using the HP for about 2 months, having spent less than $150 to meet my needs.  I am pleased with my decision.  Smaller footprint, good print quality, easy setup, excellent single-page scanning.  Everything I needed.

author: C
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024
content: As the title says, it prints well and it scans well… when it’s connected to the computer. The wifi connection is great when it works, that is maybe 25% of the time. You cannot have the printer off when you start your computer or it will refuse to connect to your computer despite HP Smart saying that it is connected to your computer. If you don’t have it connected when you start, you might as well forget about printing. There is NO OPTION FOR USB, you have no choice but to use the wireless connection and thus when it doesn’t connect the 75% of the time it doesn’t wanna work, you’re SOL. It is not worth the hassle nor is it worth the ink subscription that you’re basically forced into getting. I would not recommend this printer at all, buy from another company or just go back to inkjet.

author: Janie G.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
content: OMG;  I unboxed and set up via WiFi on my Android cell in less that 10 min total.It was sheer joy! As 73 yr old techie lady I was prepared for a challenge but nope not necessary. I just read directions and set up easy peazy.This was so different from setting up the brother inkjet I purchased last month. I struggled and still couldn't get it to make simple copy without defaulting to web/PC or somewhere other than my 4 n1 unit.My laptop is experiencing Win O/S issues and so I used my 2 yr old Moto Android cell for set up.Directions easy to read and follow. Printer worked perfectly and now I can print and copy without reinventing the wheel every time I need a hard copy.This machine is also very small. I was pleasantly surprised by the footprint.The simple to use display is easy to use and read.It's a little noisy but who cares when it's quick and efficient.I would recommend and would purchase again. So happy to finally have a printer from this decade to interface with my newer electronics.

It does not.  It takes toner 141a.  Please beware as now I have several backup toner cartridges that I can't return and I have no use for.  It's my fault for assuming Amazon wouldn't offer me a non-compatible toner cartridges in their listings.  Live and learn

author: Ryan
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
content: I bought this to replace an outdated printer. It was the only printer in stock at the time that I could get quickly. I would NOT have purchased had I known that HP began to bake in a software issue that essentially prevents the printer from printing every so often with a "Account Needs Attention" warning. Come to find out the attention it needed was that they hold you hostage in order to sell you their HP Toner Replacement program. I use this printer for business and print many pages a day. Having the printer just stop printing until I fight with the account to override the error is annoying and shouldn't be allowed. BUYER BEWARE. When it works, it's a great little printer.

author: louienapoli
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
content: I need a wireless printer for my business. The HP MFP 140w seemed great for the first six to eight months. Then it began showing error message 79. Meaning it would not connect to the computer or vice-versa. The HP tech support was very good. They spent two hours on two occasions with me on the phone installing new firmware. It didn't help. They said they would send me a new printer as it's under warranty. They didn't follow up. They also could not explain why a new printer would be free from the problem, nor could they diagnose the cause of the problem. I'm probably going to put this on the sidewalk and buy a Brother, which is what I used to use when the computer was hooked to the printer. I don't know if it will be better. I know it can't be worse.

author: Diane Adams
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
content: I'm using this with an iPad. Wireless set up took 1 minute using WPS. You do not have to use the HP Smart app to set-up, print or make copies. You do have to use it to scan. And you do have to give it access to your wireless network to scan. However you do not need it for anything but scanning and you can turn off its' permission to the network under settings, Privacy, on the iPad. You can tell HP not to annoy you with anything when you set up the account. It cost $99.99 when I bought it in August, so a pretty good deal as my Canon copier (I bought the HP primarily to make copies) has an issue with the laser unit right now. From my quick look at the HP Smart app I judge it, the app, to be somewhat difficult to use but very full featured if that is what you are looking for. This printer/copier/scanner is small, lightweight and fast and very easy to use. For those who say that the app doesn't work on a desktop, there is a separate piece of software for the desktop machines. And for those who found no directions, you must download the user manual from HP. Just Google "HP LaserJet MFP M140w Wireless Printer user manual" and get it. The quick start guide is in the box as is the power cord. You can attach this printer to a desktop/laptop via USB with the proper cord which is not included.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
content: I came out of retirement about 24 months ago to assist a former client with a project.  My Brother multifunction machine, purchased back in 2017, quit working after updating my notebook’s operating system and I decided it was time to replace to the Brother.  I didn’t want to spend more than $200 as the assignment is nearing completion and decided on the HP M140W with wireless printing and scanning abilities.  I’ve now been using the HP for about 2 months, having spent less than $150 to meet my needs.  I am pleased with my decision.  Smaller footprint, good print quality, easy setup, excellent single-page scanning.  Everything I needed.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

As certified by
author: Janie G.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
content: OMG;  I unboxed and set up via WiFi on my Android cell in less that 10 min total.It was sheer joy! As 73 yr old techie lady I was prepared for a challenge but nope not necessary. I just read directions and set up easy peazy.This was so different from setting up the brother inkjet I purchased last month. I struggled and still couldn't get it to make simple copy without defaulting to web/PC or somewhere other than my 4 n1 unit.My laptop is experiencing Win O/S issues and so I used my 2 yr old Moto Android cell for set up.Directions easy to read and follow. Printer worked perfectly and now I can print and copy without reinventing the wheel every time I need a hard copy.This machine is also very small. I was pleasantly surprised by the footprint.The simple to use display is easy to use and read.It's a little noisy but who cares when it's quick and efficient.I would recommend and would purchase again. So happy to finally have a printer from this decade to interface with my newer electronics.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

content: I bought this printer as used-like new, but when I received it, the scanner wasn’t working. I contacted HP Ink, and their agent helped me try to fix the problem. author: miked0517
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
content: When the old printer became unreliable and bit the dust, which was an earlier model HP LaserJet which looked identical to this machine, we wanted to get another one with the same features of printing, scanning and copying because it served our needs in the home.  This one had the wireless feature. and after setup, it worked conveniently from any place in the house via phone, laptop or notebook.  With the older model, you had to be on site to use the functions.  The only drawback to this newer model is that the supply of cartridges that I had on hand for the older model would not work with the new printer as it needed a different series of cartridge.

author: Mary jane
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
content: I'm glad I didn't have to return this printer because it's pretty heavy. I bought this printer because it's wired and I don't like change. That's partially true, but I feel like a wired printer is more reliable than not wired. I know it's just a matter of time before wired printers will no longer be available. The setup was pretty easy, I did have to go through the steps a few times but it was only a few steps. The thing I was doing wrong was that I did not delete the old printer. Fortunately this printer used both of the same cords  - power and computer connector as the old printer. The old printer was a Brother and it had a paper jam which I could not remove. So I had to get rid of it - drag.

author: Jazzy B
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024

author: M. Conlon
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
content: Using this since December 2023 and it has been working great. I went with the wired version and keep it off wifi because all of the issues people complained about. I haven't had a single issue with the wired version. Stay away from any "let it think for you" options. You can extend toner life easily by scaling down the print density in options. For documents, I works great, prints fast, and toner is way cheaper than ink.

author: Amelia
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2022
content: i don’t understand so many negative comments. first off it took me 5 min to setup and start printing i didn’t have a problem until i decided to change the wifi password and i couldn’t get it connected. amazon representative and HP support we’re amazing yeah there was a little wait but i didn’t mind because at the end they helped me resolve my issue. so if you plan on changing your wifi password all you have to do is hold the wifi and X button at the same time for 5 seconds then it should reset the wifi network and you can update it on the HP smart app.i haven’t had any issues with the app which i love so much nor any paper jams. i print a lot and so far i haven’t experienced any smudging on the paper. i will update if i run into any problems. i would recommend this product to anyone its a perfect size and does everything copy, fax, scan. i will add pictures later

author: Hisox
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2022
content: All functions great. Installed easily on new HP computer, nearly as easy on Apple iPad. Had a bit of difficulty installing on Android powered phone. Once I realized I had failed to turn off the VPN the phone saddled right up. I now configured the security to manual switch just to make me more aware of it. A person can also configure to bypass a local network and the VPN will egnor your devices while still giving protection. Greet little printer. A pleasure to use. I don't need to log onto any site just push the print decal once a file is pulled up. This makes 11 Hp laser printers I am currently using on different platforms with another 3 inkjet printers. Hewlett Packard, of course. They keep trucking on.

author: John Willis
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
content: Xerox over complicates the options and setup. Its very very difficult for a non-technical person to setup this printer. There is also a lot of scary diversionary tactics about don't buy Xerox toner or its too expensive, which its really not. The marketing and sale literature is terrible.. it could be easily be fixed by anyone walking through a setup with a non-Xerox person, they are too cult insulated from real world to realize how non-nonsensical their terminology and open-ended their arbitrary statements are.. throw away the manual, its more confusing than helpful.. you can sort of figure it out.. if your an experienced technical person. The videos on YouTube for Xerox are a little better.. since you can "see" what they are intuiting and not describing or telling you.. might as well turn the audio off however, because its more confusing than helpful.. they say one thing and do another.. its bizarre.

name: Xerox C310DNI Color Printer, Laser, Wireless, Print, Letter, Energy Star Certified, UP to 35PPM
description:

author: KS
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
content: When I first got the printer I was having some issues with AirPrint. In so much that the printer would show up for maybe 2 to 3 minutes after initial power up but then it would disappear.  This was really odd behavior.  So I updated firmware and still it did the same thing.  Called technical support we walked through some things to no avail.  They did escalate to tier 2 support.  In the mean time I tried some more troubleshooting and the network behavior made no sense.  The unit always said it was online and you could ping it and print to it via IP so again why was AirPrint such an issue.  Now note that if the unit was hardwired there was no issues at all.  So looking at it a little deeper I found that AirPrint uses Bonjour on UDP/5353 which being UDP makes for an sometimes questionable connection.  So then I decided to reboot my router and that solved the issues.  So even though it was connected to my wifi network the router for what ever reason was having issues with that port.  When tech support did finally call me back and we discussed the issue as I found it and they really did not have a good explanation for what happened.  All is good now and am happy so far.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

author: dAve
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
content: After only a few short months of use, this printer started jamming when printing anything double-sided. It was a problem regardless of whether I was printing double-sided word documents or graphics. Sometimes the printer picked up multiple sheets of paper at once, and I thought that might have been causing the jams. But it was jamming even when it didn't pick up more sheets than it should. Maybe 1 in 10  double sided print jobs have been working recently. AND the printer doesn't recognize it whenever I clear the jam. I have to open/close the printer front door 4-5 times before the printer realizes that I cleared the jam - and then it jams again. Also, Xerox will refuse to give you a refund for a printer still under warranty.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: BILL O'NEILL
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024
content: In the past, I have used hp printers with my hp computer, thinking the same brands should work well together; they do not. HP printers have fantastic hardware, except for the software. There is always a lengthy process to install new drivers and always a problem with updates. Frequently in the middle of printing, the computer could no longer find the hp printer. Why am I talking about hp printers? Because in comparison, this Xerox printer was so easy to get out of the box, load the driver, and print, I thought there must be some problem. There was not. I do have one problem with this Xerox printer that I never had with the hp printers; paper jams. About every 25 pages or so, I need to open the front panel and remove a sheet of paper. The printer knows that that page was not completed, so all of the proper pages are printed. I find this a minor inconvenience compared to no communication with the printer. I am glad that I made this choice.
cot_reasoning: No strong positive or negative words found; marked as neutral.

author: John Doe
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024
content: I've had this printer for a year and a half. This printer prints decently, but only when all four toner cartridges have toner in them. If a color cartridge is empty and you want to print black and white, it won't. And toner cartridges are pricey. I bought replacement cartridges that claimed to be compatible with the C310. They look just like the ones in the printer, except they don't say Xerox. The printer doesn't recognize them. Several months ago, the printer started to turn on when I was using my computer. If I didn't hit OK to cancel the print job, and then hit OK several more times, it printed a sheet. It would do this multiple times a day. If you need a new printer, check out Consumer Reports and Wirecutter, and get one they recommend.

author: Greg D. Pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2022
content: You get what you pay for.  Good quality small workgroup color laser.  Doesn't take up a lot of space, quiet, fast, great quality.  Comes with starter package of toner installed.  I have purchased two of these printers.  In both cases, I had to clean up toner powder and reinstall the cartridges before use.  You'll need to order spare toner and when you do, watch out for the cost.  I don't recommend getting knock-off toner.  I would stick to Xerox but keep in mind that this is where the money is made.  Good tech support, easy set up for WiFi, Ethernet or USB.

author: Daniel Renaud
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
content: Didn’t buy this printer from Amazon but I have the same one at work and first I’ll say it’s print quality is actually pretty good. Color images come out very well, vivid, and accurate.  The paper tray has a good size to it and the double sided printing works well.  Overall good speed too.  Only used the feature once or twice but the wireless direct printing also works well.  Now for the downside… good luck finding Xerox toner for this thing.  Standard capacity cartridges are about $100 each for each color (B,Y,M,C)… fine… except Xerox doesn’t seem to be able to keep it stocked.  I haven’t been able to find a bundle for all 4 cartridges in standard capacity but they do sell a high yield 4 pack… when not out of stock, for $800.

content: In the past, I have used hp printers with my hp computer, thinking the same brands should work well together; they do not. HP printers have fantastic hardware, except for the software. content: Great quality machine, and I tried some other brands first. Both PCL and PostScript. Downside is expensive toner , although you can purchase third party toner (color not as good as oem). Fast double-sided printing. One of the best small office laser printers I’ve owned, and I’ve had HP, Canon, and Dell. Returned HP for this and am very glad I did. Setup was a breeze. Occasionally loses wireless network, but a quick restart does the trick. Restarts fast. Drivers are good, but could be better. Overall, a great printer for a small or home office.

author: John Willis
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
content: Xerox over complicates the options and setup. Its very very difficult for a non-technical person to setup this printer. There is also a lot of scary diversionary tactics about don't buy Xerox toner or its too expensive, which its really not. The marketing and sale literature is terrible.. it could be easily be fixed by anyone walking through a setup with a non-Xerox person, they are too cult insulated from real world to realize how non-nonsensical their terminology and open-ended their arbitrary statements are.. throw away the manual, its more confusing than helpful.. you can sort of figure it out.. if your an experienced technical person. The videos on YouTube for Xerox are a little better.. since you can "see" what they are intuiting and not describing or telling you.. might as well turn the audio off however, because its more confusing than helpful.. they say one thing and do another.. its bizarre.

As certified by
author: KS
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
content: When I first got the printer I was having some issues with AirPrint. In so much that the printer would show up for maybe 2 to 3 minutes after initial power up but then it would disappear.  This was really odd behavior.  So I updated firmware and still it did the same thing.  Called technical support we walked through some things to no avail.  They did escalate to tier 2 support.  In the mean time I tried some more troubleshooting and the network behavior made no sense.  The unit always said it was online and you could ping it and print to it via IP so again why was AirPrint such an issue.  Now note that if the unit was hardwired there was no issues at all.  So looking at it a little deeper I found that AirPrint uses Bonjour on UDP/5353 which being UDP makes for an sometimes questionable connection.  So then I decided to reboot my router and that solved the issues.  So even though it was connected to my wifi network the router for what ever reason was having issues with that port.  When tech support did finally call me back and we discussed the issue as I found it and they really did not have a good explanation for what happened.  All is good now and am happy so far.
cot_reasoning: Identified positive words suggesting satisfaction or recommendation.

author: dAve
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
content: After only a few short months of use, this printer started jamming when printing anything double-sided. It was a problem regardless of whether I was printing double-sided word documents or graphics. Sometimes the printer picked up multiple sheets of paper at once, and I thought that might have been causing the jams. But it was jamming even when it didn't pick up more sheets than it should. Maybe 1 in 10  double sided print jobs have been working recently. AND the printer doesn't recognize it whenever I clear the jam. I have to open/close the printer front door 4-5 times before the printer realizes that I cleared the jam - and then it jams again. Also, Xerox will refuse to give you a refund for a printer still under warranty.
